snippet: Unsatisfying wars are the stock in trade of counterinsurgency; rarely will they look like a conventional victory.
abstract: Prof John A Nagl Op-Ed article questions whether the eventual end of the war in Afghanistan will more closely resemble the tolerable compromise of the Iraq conflict, or the messy chaos that marked the end of the Vietnam war; contends that occupations beset by counterinsurgencies rarely yield a clear victory.
lead_paragraph: Unsatisfying wars are the stock in trade of counterinsurgency; rarely will they look like a conventional victory.

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
